_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This is an executive summary of the policies, procedures and activities for compliance with the EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Requirements - Risk Management Program pursuant to Title 40 Part 68 of the Code of Federal Regulations (40 CFR 68) for Roquette America Inc.'s (RAI's) Gurnee Illinois facility (Gurnee facility).



<> The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source [40 CFR 68.155(a)]:

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies are addressed in the individual RMP procedures which detail the RMP program requirements as well as how RAI complies with the applicable requirements. The Gurnee facility is a non-responding facility for releases of the RMP-listed chemicals, so the site utilizes an Emergency Action Plan. 



<> The stationary source and regulated substances handled [40 CFR 68.155(b)]:

RAI owns, operates, and controls hydrogen handling equipment (piping, valves, etc.) that is interconnected with a hydrogen storage system with a capacity greater than 10,000 pounds. The hydrogen storage system is owned, operated, and controlled by Praxair, Inc. (Praxair) and RAI has no access to the storage system. More specifically, Praxair's storage system is located on the RAI site and is inside a fenced area to which RAI does not have access. Piping from the hydrogen storage system passes across the chain link fence and into RAI's process.



<> The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps [40 CFR 68.155(c)]:

RAI is responsible for all components of the covered process that are outside of the Praxair compound. Praxair is responsible to RAI for all components of the covered process inside the Praxair compound. The Gurnee facility has implemented the Program Level 3 prevention program requirements under the RMP regulations. The required elements of the RMP prevention program are listed below:



 - Employee Participation

 - Process Safety Information

- Process Hazard Analysis

 - Operating Procedures

 - Training

 - Contractor Safety

 - Pre-startup Safety Review

 - Mechanical Integrity

 - Safe Work Practices, including Hot Work Permit

 - Management of Change

 - Incident Investigation

 - Compliance Audits



These items, their specific requirements, and how the RAI Gurnee facility complies with the requirements are addressed in the individual procedural documents.



<> The five-year accident history [40 CFR 68.155(d)]:

The Gurnee facility has had zero RMP reportable incidents in the previous five years.



<> The emergency response program [40 CFR 68.155(e)]:

The Gurnee facility is a non-responding facility for releases of the RMP-listed chemicals, so the site utilizes an Emergency Action Plan. The Emergency Action Plan that includes specific actions to be taken in the event of an accidental release, procedures for informing the public and local agencies, and information on emergency health care.



<> Planned changes to improve safety [40 CFR 68.155(f)]:

The Gurnee facility is committed to improving our safety systems by implementing recommendations identified from Process Hazards Analysis (PHA) and compliance audits.
